caption: My wife and I REALLY wanted to like this place and were excited to try it because we only live a mile away and love Ichicoro. Unfortunately it was very disappointing. First: there is hardly any parking at all and we had to walk a couple of blocks just to get there. Second: I dropped my very obviously 8-month pregnant wife off at the door so she could be seated with our reservation while I parked and ran back. I was shocked to discover that they absolutely refused to seat her until I was there. Making a super pregnant woman stand for no reason? Classy. Third: I discovered that they automatically add 10% to your bill as a service charge for the staff, yet still expect you to tip in addition. You want to provide a higher wage to the staff? That’s fantastic and I support it. So add 10% to your prices. Don’t pretend your food costs less than it really does. Fourth and to top it off: our food took over one hour to arrive. Honestly the more I think about it the angrier I get. It was just all around a terrible experience. The chicken was very good though, hence the extra star. I might try it again in six months to see if they figured things out but I’m not holding my breath.

The wings are out of control — the batter is so light and crispy and the chicken is perfectly seasoned! I highly recommend adding the perilla leaves. The minty, anise flavor really compliments the richness of the fried chicken and ranch sauce. The cocktails are bold, but balanced. Try the soju! It’s like vodka, but smoother and sweeter.  We also enjoyed the vibe. It’s low key and funky. And our server was friendly and knowledgable. We are looking forward to trying more of the menu and having brunch on the back patio!

The bone-in wings were incredibly crispy and so flavorful they didn’t even need the dipping sauce (even though the sauce was amazing!). The bulgogi and Nebraska cocktail were great! The attention-to-detail ambiance and great service was the cherry on top. Loved being able to sit on the outdoor deck on a chilly night. We’ll be back!
Make sure to do a reservation before walking in.
Hipsters

Finally tried this fun Korean “fried” chicken restaurant. The inside is fun, fresh and well spaced with COVID-19 protocols in place. We had the Bulgogi Beef, Kimchi fried rice and a few Suji margaritas. The food was excellent, the rice was a little spicy for me, but I didn’t read the description. I mixed it with the white rice from the beef 👌🏻 and it made it better. Definitely a must-try in the area.

I couldn't wait for this place to open because it looked so promising. I was not disappointed, I came on opening day and was amazed at the cuisine. I would like to keep this place to myself, but you have to come to appreciate the work management and staff put into giving you an awesome experience that you'll want to shout about. Hats off to the G-Men (that means women too), lol.
Great food and fast service
Food,  drinks and service were great.  Highly recommend!!
Fire wings
Very friendly atmosphere.  Can't be too dressed up or down.  Portions are large.  Variety of flavorful sauces and sides.
I suggest making a reservation.  Food was delicious, ordered way to much and had to take home leftovers.

If you're like me you like your food HOT when it comes to the table.  I must say I thoroughly ENJOYED this Korean restaurant/food. It was delicious, HOT, and served pretty quickly.  The drinks are delicious. The staff is very attentive, friendly,  and knowledgeable when making recommendations.  If you live in Tampa it's a must try.

Very peaceful vibe. Beer selection was nice and they had a great mix of local drafts and cans/bottles including Korean beer which they were unfortunately out of. We ordered the tteokbokki (rice cakes in spicy sauce with cheese) and 12 bone in wings with sweet chili garlic and Korean bbq sauces. The tteokbokki was awesome and tasted quite authentic. The fried chicken was awesome too, and despite what other reviews state ours was super crispy- audibly crispy from other tables type of crispy which is typical for Korean fried chicken. The sauces were awesome too. 12 wings and tteokbokki were enough for us two and we took home some left overs. I do wish though that we had more pickled daikon then we got but otherwise this place is
Great food, great atmosphere. Definitely a must visit if in the area. The food here is more of a Korean fusion, and it tastes great if given the right expectations.

I really wanted to leave a good review but it took 1 whole hour to get a single order of 6 piece chicken wings for take out. I’d understand and be sympathetic if you’re busy, but there were 3 tables seated there on a Sunday night. LOL.

Let me start with that the service was phenomenal. My fiancé and I were taken care of so well, and we loved the recommended cocktails that our servers gave us. We both went with the boneless chicken wings in Korean BBQ sauce and Sweet Thai Garlic sauce. The servings were perfect and the taste was out of this world. I also loved that I could watch some anime along with my food haha. I honestly can't wait to come back.

I got the rice cakes, which I had never had before, and they were amazing! Great vegetarian option. The pickles were amaaazing as well! Really enjoyed the atmosphere and the covered back porch seating area.

This is NOT authentic Korean food and very overpriced.. was not impressed and will not return. Service and atmosphere were great, however, the food was not. I came with my boyfriend and  his twin who are Korean, they even agreed this was no where near authentic Korean food.
It's a lovely place, great atmosphere and very nice staff. The chicken sandwich was over cooked, and tough. The boneless wings were just just dark meat. We will fine for drinks instead.
Great experience, decor, and atmosphere. The service was excellent and I'll definitely be returning

The food tasted great and the service was awesome! Gangchu has a cool NYC vibe (if you enjoy that) but also comes with NYC prices. The theme is Korea street food but expect to pay triple the amount of actual Korea street food. As someone who was born and raised in Korea, I feel that I have some credibility when reviewing the food (and price). I tried some of the hot wings, the kimchi fried rice and bulgogi. The food was flavourful  but not Korean. If you are looking for authentic Korean cuisine, Gangchu might not be for you. Expect a 10% service fee on top of the already expensive menu pricing. The service fees goes toward the employees, not the managers or business owners. This fee goes directly to the employees to provide them with a more livable wage. This is great! I just wish the business would build these fees into their menu prices and just pay their employees what they want? I'm not sure why they advertise the service fee. It all seemed a bit pretentious. I love that the Seminole Heights area is bringing in small, local restaurants. The SH area has really been anchored by their growing bars and restaurants. I'm just not sure how well the business will do with their surrounding neighborhoods. Most of the SH community is low income households. I think restaurants like Gangchu will have to rely on people coming from all over Tampa to try their food. I'm not sure how sustainable the prices will be in the long run.

Nice atmosphere and wings were plump and juicy. Was expecting a Korean restaurant but this far from it. My wrap was like a burrito with tasteless meat inside. Am so disappointed but hopefully they make the adjustments. Management was spectacular and addressed my concerns. Hope they add to the menu.

The wings are HUGE with a light batter that was crisped up nicely but both "sauces" we chose (Korean BBQ and Dry Rub) were kinda bland. We knew they were on the mild side but neither had any real character, I especially thought the dry rub lacks a little kick. We will try something else next time. They were well prepared though and came out quickly. My other reason to knock a star off the rating is drink prices. $12 for a Single Makers Mark and $13 for Jack and Coke is just way too high. I'll check beer prices next time. I'm not sure about the automatic 10% service charge, I always tip at least 15% even for pretty poor service and usually much more so I just adjust to the 10% already being there and they don't hide it but it's an odd thing to do.
Awesome food and service and great little spot

Fantastic, new hip spot located in Seminole Heights with the friendliest staff, eclectic cocktails & delicious food. The Korean BBQ wings and Bulgogi Beef were my fave.  I cannot wait to go back and try more.
Chicken and Beer at its Finest. Boneless or regular. The Bulgogi is to Die For!!! Kimichi fried rice thank Me Later!!
Best Korean restaurant in Seminole Heights. Incredible food, great service, cool atmosphere. Will be back.

Solid place for delicious chicken. Love the concept and the serving staff is super friendly. The Korean dry rub had a smoky taste to it with a hint of celery salt. The Yuzu pepper had a sweetness to it that wasn't too overpowering and paired well with the crispy chicken skin. Kim chi fried rice also had a sweet taste that is different but good. Happy I don't have to go to Orlando for Korean fried chicken all the time.

It was a disappointing experience. I was one of the first people at the restaurant when they opened at 4, and when I arrived home, I saw that they messed my order up. I asked for bone in wings, and they gave me boneless. I wouldn't have worried about it that much if they charged me for boneless, but they charged me the higher price that comes with bone-in wings. I tried the Korean BBQ flavor and their Korean dry rub. The Korean BBQ wings were chewy and bland, and the dry rub wings were flavorless. The fries were soggy, starchy, and barely seasoned. I was looking forward to going to a dedicated Korean chicken restaurant in Tampa, but Gangchu was a let-down.  They do charge a 10% service charge with take-out orders, so do keep that in mind if you decide to go there.
Great food, great atmosphere, will definitely be back!
The food and service were both excellent ! We will definitely be  back.

Gangchu completely lived up to its name...it truly was THE SH%T!!!! Service was excellent, and the food was completely legit!!! Extremely tasty, fresh, and novel!! It’s obvious the owners know EXACTLY what they are doing!!! Y’all are slaying it! I will be there frequently!

Normally I don't write reviews but little disappointed with the food, maybe because I'm Korean and expected better or different. I read alot of these reviews and had a similar type experience. I order 4 different wings, kimchi fried rice, bulgogi and beer. First the good, the kpop ipa was good and two of the wing sauces I liked. The other two I didn't, the dry rub was like just lil seasoning shaked in top, flavorless. The bulgogi and kimch fried rice were ok not great but were severely over priced, $14 for a small portion of kimchi rice. The Korean side dishes or Banchan were very tiny like a small spoon ful in tiny sauce dishes and didn't taste anything like authentic side dishes why call it banchan if it doesn't taste anything like it. Service was fine, feels like a trendy type of place but for $85 I expected more. I don't mind over priced food if it was good. This was just ok. Food was very slow coming out too. I don't mind the 10% on top of bill, I understand that but again 2 beers 24wings small bulgogi and small kimchi fried rice seems high maybe good if someone hasn't had Korean food before.

Disappointed. I lived in Korea for 7 years, in a Korean family, This is NOT Korean Chicken and Beer. Great Concept but poor execution. Despite waiting 25+ min for our food and the 30% Upcharge (10% + 20% Tip), my bone to pick is with the food. They don't even use the #1 Korean yangnyeom sauce or #2 Soy Sauce chicken, they have these marketable made up sauces that didn't hit the mark. You have to specifically ask for Bone In because its not on the menu. The Pajeon looked like Fried French Toast and I don't even remember tasting the "Pa" (green onion) in it. I went there for Chicken, but I ended up only eating the Tteokbokki (Rice Cakes), the only thing that tasted Korean. Also bulgogi is Philly Cheese Steak Meat just with Bulgogi sauce. Maybe my expectations were high or they should have been marketed as "Asian Eats", I was really expecting legit Korean Chicken and Beer and its definitely not.
The bulgolgi wrap was literally a philly cheese steak with kimchi. Definitely not bulgolgi meat.
The fired chicken was so good especially the different flavors was mouth watering
Really enjoyed the food, service and atmosphere. Very clean friendly and unique!
This place slaps. The Buffalo is *chefs kiss* and the dry rub is right there with it.  Also love that they’re paying their staff a decent wage too.

I had a bad experience with service and wasn't even able to try the food. I arrived with my friend a few minutes before 5pm on a Saturday, the restaurant had opened only a few weeks ago. After waiting more than ten minutes to even be acknowledged, they said I would not be seated without a reservation. The hostess said no reservations were available until 9-9:30 pm. I could see that only 5 of the 12 inside tables were in use, and only one of the outside tables was in use. It seemed odd that a restaurant less than half full in the afternoon would turn away two paying customers over a reservation policy, after just opening in today's market. But worse, no other dining option was offered, not sit at the bar, or take out. During the time I waited before being turned away, another employee was at the host station, leaning against the wall and talking on the phone, but never looked up or acknowledged me. Two other employees stood behind the station talking, also never smiled a greeting or made eye contact. Such an unfriendly place.

Wings were everything they were advertised to be:Spicy, Crispy, and with complex flavors.  More impressive, I'd hold the cocktails up to any of the other seminole heights spots.  I like beer as much as the next guy but I'm calling this place chicken and cocktails.  Can already tell this is going to become a regular Friday happy hour spot.

Love the sauce options for the chicken wings. Sweet chili garlic was my favorite. The chicken was moist and flavorful. Hopefully once they've been open for longer they'll speed up the time it takes for the order to be ready as it took longer than expected.
Everything was yummy and the food came out in a timely fashion. Ambiance is quite nice! Also, everyone on staff if very knowledgeable and friendly.
Great atmosphere, food, cocktails, & staff! Most definitely a new Seminole Heights classic.

Love the concept of this place and the atmosphere is amazing. The open concept is great and felt it was accommodating to socially distant from others. Staff was courteous and friendly. Chef Noel has done a great job with this menu and once again is bringing fresh and creative flavors to the Tampa area. The gochujang Buffalo and sweet chili garlic sauces were our favorites. The Soju Mojito was excellent and loved the exclusive 7th Sun Brewery K-Hop IPA.

I loved this place. Speaking as a vegetarian I knew there wouldn’t be a ton here that I could personally eat but my boyfriend and I still wanted to try it and were not disappointed! Kimchi pancake was delicious and their honey mustard sauce paired perfectly w/ their fries. Cocktails were good, service was great, building itself was beautiful. Will definitely be coming back again and again.
Takeout was easy, wings were crispy, and sauces were delicious
This place is amazing. Definitely visiting again soon. Everything was delicious! The outdoor seating area is nice and spacious. So happy this place opened!
Amazing!!

Just finished my meal here and I'm honestly surprised about the amount of negative reviews. I can't speak for the authenticity of Korean fried chicken, but I can definitely say that I enjoyed my wings, which stayed crispy even though they were covered entirely with sauce. Also, I appreciate that the boneless chicken is dark meat. It was very juicy and flavorful. Everything I had was seasoned well. I will certainly be back.
One word sums it up: Delicious!!!! Loved It!!!!

I really had hopes on this restaurant, but what can I say, another bad review. If you get a reservation they won't let you seat until all of the persons are there. They had 5 tables empty for over 40 minutes, and told me I need to wait 45 minutes to 1 hour because my friend was struggling to find parking so they cannot keep the table. I saw people left the place because no table available when the lobby was almost empty from 7:00 pm to 7:40 pm all of us know last reservation is 8pm. They could have seat two of us and get money from us but their policy says otherwise. Anyway, I didn't expect much when a Korean restaurant have a white american lady at the front door.
Fantastic place to have a nice evening great drinks and top tier korean food. Very well thought for all the dishes they have I have tried every plate and do plan to return for more.

Welcome to the neighborhood Gangchu! Myself and my girlfriend went for our first experience and were very impressed - Chef Noel Cruz does it again! The atmosphere is a welcomed addition to Seminole Heights, bringing the right energy and decor to make you feel like you’re really being immersed in the concept.  Korean BBQ Fried Chicken Wings are something that I seek at other restaurants, and i'm happy I finally found my go-to spot for satisfying that craving!  Next up was the Bulgogi Beef Plate - impressive portion size! Banchan was a great compliment, my favorite is the bean sprouts - they’re delicious.  Drinks from the bar were delicious and served quick - i’m excited to come back with some friends and see how many beer towers we can put back!!  I will say that i’m sad I didn’t get the Crispy Fried Chicken, I saw it come out of the kitchen, and knew that it would probably be my favorite thing on the menu but had to wait till next time because we already ordered.  Overall, GREAT job and incredible service - its clear they’ve done a great job training the team to be knowledgable about the menu, concept, and beverages. The staff was following all guidelines and recommendations to make customers feel welcome AND safe in the restaurant.  To the comments from the first few days on running out of small items - it’s a brand new concept that opened during a pandemic — relax, and applaud them for a monumental accomplishment. Gangchu has my vote!

people are being absolute divas. The place has been open for 2 days, they're doing great. "my chicken was just above average- 2 stars" who tf are these people. They have good service, food was good, atmosphere was good- give it a shot. Ignore the people that eat there then rush home to leave a rage review. Its a good local spot that you should support. Happy its opened- wish you guys the best! josh was a great waiter.

Unimpressive and pricey for that you get. This place has a lot of potential, but it’s just not there yet. The menu is very limited and they don’t offer any type of bowls to build. They were all out of bone-in wings and their boneless wings were only dark meat, chewy, and lacking flavor. Not sure if we will go back for a while.

Really disappointed, read reviews about them running out of bone in wings but figured they would've restocked by the next day as they open at 4pm! Bulgogi was salty and flavor was off.  Tteokbokki was flavorless, dry. Won't be coming back unfortunately.

Had the 12 piece wings with a mix of Gojuchang Buffalo and Korean dry rub. Wings were good and the atmosphere was nice and inviting. Staff were friendly, helpful and COVID-safe. Happy hour from 4-6 gets you $2 off any beer, wine or craft cocktails. Another great addition to Seminole Heights!

Wanted to love it this Korean Fried Chicken joint but unfortunately it just didn’t deliver.  Chicken was slightly above average.  Any thing besides the chicken was terribly overpriced and the quality was sorely lacking.  For example I got Kim Chi on the side for $1.50 and it was given to me in a small sauce jar... basically 2 or 3 bites.

5 stars with one caveat. We had the bone-in wings as an appetizer, awesome. The beef bulgogi and crispy chicken sandwich were great.  The caveat were the fries.  The fries were very much undercooked.  Everything else was 🔥.  It was opening night, though.

So I had reservations at 7:45 and couldn't even get me a table so they asked if I would like to sit at the bar. By this time it's 8:15 and I had gotten there at 7:40. Once we got situated we ordered and told us that they don't have any more wings. You are called Gangchu CHICKEN and beer! How the hell are you already out of chicken and are open till 11? I was really excited about this place but on first impression that it gave me was nothing but disappointment!

Got takeout on their opening night. Place was packed with a lot of people waiting to be seated. The restaurant looked very nice. Food was luckily ready to go at the quoted time and my wife and I loved it!

I love the concept of this place and I think they executed it very well. Their Korean-style chicken was very crispy and had plenty of great sweet and spicy sauces to toss the chicken in or use for dipping. They also had lots of interesting cocktails that were local-inspired along with a full bar.  The restaurant had a fun, dynamic atmosphere that could range from a relaxed, sit-down eating experience to a fun, social vibe by grabbing wings and a drink at the bar. Parking is scarce so be prepared to street park.
